Class TimeManager

java.lang.Object
us.stomberg.solarsystemsim.TimeManager
public class TimeManager extends Object
The TimeManager class manages time-related aspects of the simulation. It handles simulation time tracking, timescale adjustments, and frame rate calculations.

This class is thread-safe with synchronization on the lock object when accessing shared state.

TODO: Make FPS a concern of the main loop, make this an object of Physics, perhaps integrated with timestep

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeManager

      public TimeManager()

  • Method Details

    • incrementDuration

      public static void incrementDuration(double dt)
      Increments the simulation time by one time step.

      This method updates both the total simulation duration and the duration since the timescale was last changed. It also recalculates the current effective timescale based on the elapsed real time.

      Parameters:
      dt - The time increment in simulation seconds

    • getDuration

      public static double getDuration()
      Retrieves the total duration of the simulation in seconds.
      Returns:
      the duration of the simulation in seconds

    • shouldUpdatePhysics

      public static boolean shouldUpdatePhysics()
      Determines whether the physics system should execute another timestep.

      This decision is based on comparing the target timescale cap with the actual timescale that has been achieved. This helps maintain synchronization between simulation time and real time according to the desired timescale.

      Returns:
      true if the physics system should update, false otherwise

    • shouldRenderFrame

      public static boolean shouldRenderFrame()
      Determines whether the next frame should be rendered.

      This decision is based on the time elapsed since the previous frame and the frame rate limit specified in the setup configuration. It helps maintain a consistent frame rate without exceeding the specified limit.

      Returns:
      true if enough time has passed to render the next frame, false otherwise

    • updateFPS

      public static void updateFPS()
      Calculates the current actual frames per second.

      This method measures the real time between successive frame renders and updates the currentFPS value accordingly. It should be called once per frame to maintain accurate FPS tracking.

    • modifyTimescaleCap

      public static void modifyTimescaleCap(TimeManager.TimeScaleChangeType change)
      Increases or decreases the timescale based on the specified change type.

      This method is bound to a keymap in the Keymaps class and adjusts the simulation speed relative to real time. The timescale is constrained to powers of ten multiplied by 1, 2, or 5 to provide intuitive speed increments.

      When the timescale is modified, the timescale tracking is reset to ensure smooth transitions between different speeds.

      Parameters:
      change - The type of change to apply (increment or decrement)

    • getTimescaleCap

      public static double getTimescaleCap()
      Gets the current target timescale.

      This value represents the desired ratio of simulation time to real time, expressed in simulation seconds per real second.

      Returns:
      The current target timescale

    • getCurrentTimeScale

      public static double getCurrentTimeScale()
      Gets the current calculated actual timescale.

      This value represents the actual achieved ratio of simulation time to real time, which may differ from the target timescale due to processing limitations. It is expressed in simulation seconds per real second.

      Returns:
      The current actual timescale

    • getCurrentFPS

      public static double getCurrentFPS()
      Gets the current frames per second measurement.

      This value represents the actual rendering frame rate achieved by the application. The value is calculated by averaging frame durations over approximately one second of real time.

      Returns:
      The current FPS value
